name: Computer Science

minor.electives: Three additional computer science courses, one of which may be a cross-listed course or another course approved by the undergraduate advising head. No COSI course numbered 10 or lower may be used toward the minor.
minor.grade: No course with a final grade below C- can count toward fulfilling the requirements for the minor in computer science.
minor.pass: No course taken pass/fail may count toward requirements for the minor.
minor.comment: Students may be exempted from COSI 11a if they either: 1) received a score of 5 on the AP Computer Science exam, or 2) successfully complete a COSI 11a placement exam. The placement exam will always be held on the first Wednesday that follows the start of classes in both the fall and spring semesters. Students who wish to take the placement exam should contact the department undergraduate or graduate advisor head at least 24 hours in advance of the exam. Note that all students who are exempted from 11a must take an additional elective that qualifies for the minor.

ba.electives: At least four additional COSI courses, excluding 99d, and one may be cross-listed. No COSI course numbered 10 or lower may be used toward the major.
ba.comment: Students may be exempted from COSI 11a if they either: 1) received a score of 5 on the AP Computer Science exam, or 2) successfully complete a COSI 11a placement exam. The placement exam will always be held on the first Wednesday that follows the start of classes in both the fall and spring semesters. Students who wish to take the placement exam should contact the department undergraduate or graduate advisor head at least 24 hours in advance of the exam. Note that all students who are exempted from 11a must take an additional elective that qualifies for the major.

bs.electives: at least five additional COSI courses, excluding 99d, and up to two courses can be cross-listed. No COSI course numbered 10 or lower may be used toward the major.
bs.grade: No course with a final grade below C- can count toward fulfilling the requirements for the major in computer science.
bs.pass: No course taken pass/fail may count toward requirements for the major.
bs.comment: Students may be exempted from COSI 11a if they either: 1) received a score of 5 on the AP Computer Science exam, or 2) successfully complete a COSI 11a placement exam. The placement exam will always be held on the first Wednesday that follows the start of classes in both the fall and spring semesters. Students who wish to take the placement exam should contact the department undergraduate or graduate advisor head at least 24 hours in advance of the exam. Note that all students who are exempted from 11a must take an additional elective that qualifies for the major.

honors: Graduation with honors in computer science requires completion and defense of a senior honors thesis; students considering this option should take note of the prerequisites for enrollment in COSI 99d (Senior Research).
